summary: Tamarind is a special tree that comes from Africa but is now found in many tropical places around the world. Its fruits look like brown pods and have a tasty, tangy pulp inside, which people use in cooking and even as a polish. The tree is useful in many ways: its wood is good for making things, the seeds can make oil, and the young leaves are eaten in some Asian cuisines. Because it's so versatile, people grow tamarind in warm climates everywhere.
title: Tamarind
